p: The susceptibility of all the S. suis isolates analyzed in this study to each EO was similar, suggesting a very homogeneous behavior of S. suis against the analyzed essential oils. MIC values ranged from 156.25 to 312.5 μg·ml −1 for oregano and common thyme, from 156.25 to 625 μg·ml −1 for red thyme, and from 312.5 to 1250 μg·ml −1 for cinnamon. The statistical comparison of the distribution of the MIC and the MBC showed significant difference between the oregano and the two thymes (group I) and the cinnamon (group II) (Table S3). These results are in accordance with the classification proposed by Freires et al. ( 2015): the essential oils with a MIC range of 101‐500 μg·ml −1 would have a strong activity and the essential oils with a MIC range 501–1000 μg·ml −1 would have a moderate activity.
